div.marquee: Due to the COVID-19 virus, the district is closed for the remainder of the school year.

div.p:
Attached below, you will find the official grading policy that teachers K-12 will follow during the school closure. As always, if you have any questions, please call the office 660-693-4812.
COVID-19 Grading Policy.pdf

a.aria-label: Read more about Covid-19 Grading Policy

div.p:
The Lady Jays brought home a District Title, the first since 2018 and only the second title in eight years. The Lady Jays played throughout the week of February 24 - 28th at Rich Hill. They beat the following opponents advancing them to the sectional game, which will be played at Nevada High School on March 3 and 6:00pm :
Miami 75-11
Hume 82-43
Appleton City 68-57

a.aria-label: Read more about Class 1 District 6 Champs

div.p: Some of our Bluejay family wanted to let all of our bluejays know how much we miss them!

a.aria-label: Read more about We Miss You!

div.p: Montrose Student Council members preparing to send off collections for the Missouri Veteran's Home in Warrensburg. Special thanks to Hank Swaters and Misty Meredith for helping organize and delivering the goods brought in from our Montrose students, parents, faculty, and staff.

a.aria-label: Read more about Student Council Gives Back!

div.em: Current conditions as of 26 Apr 16:35 pm CDT

td.span: Mostly sunny, with a high near 70. Light west southwest wind.

A chance of rain, mainly before 11pm, then a chance of showers and thunderstorms after 1am. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 53. Southeast wind 3 to 7 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts of less than a tenth of an inch, except higher amounts possible in thunderstorms.

A chance of rain and thunderstorms before 1pm, then a slight chance of rain between 1pm and 4pm. Partly sunny, with a high near 71. South southwest wind 8 to 16 mph, with gusts as high as 29 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts of less than a tenth of an inch, except higher amounts possible in thunderstorms.
